content.description: This climbs a manufactured (drilled holds) sequence through roughly 6 holds in a row by an unknown.
content.location: The left climb at the crag, it climbs close to the arete for about half of the climb.

content.description:
Start up the easy finger crack, and then work your way left to the first bolt after gaining the ledge. After clipping the first bolt, avoid using the bad rock out far right. From here, continue up, and then enjoy figuring out the crux sequence at the final bolt. If you don't want to bring gear, you can also traverse in from

Long Island

. If doing this, maybe bring a #4 to place in a pod between bolts to make yourself feel safer.
content.protection: Gear from #0.3 to #1 plus 4 bolts to rap rings.
content.location: Look for the finger crack start on the right.

content.description: Climb easy terrain to the first bolt where the fun begins. Work your way up to the third bolt, and make a thin move to gain the ledge. After clipping bolt five, find the good holds to get yourself to the anchors.
content.location: It is the middle climb on the wall.
